meanings.definition: A brief or incomplete view or sight.
meanings.sent1: She caught quick glimpses of the colorful birds in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The hiker enjoyed the glimpses of the stunning mountain scenery.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel played hide-and-seek, giving only brief glimpses of itself.
meanings.sent4: In the busy city, the neon lights offered glimpses of a vibrant nightlife.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, the horizon was painted with fleeting glimpses of pink and orange.

meanings.definition: To see or perceive briefly or partially.
meanings.sent1: He glimpses the deer darting through the forest before it disappears into the trees.
meanings.sent2: The detective glimpses a suspicious figure lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat tries to glimpse the mysterious visitor through the keyhole.
meanings.sent4: Her memory often glimpses moments from her childhood like old photographs.
meanings.sent5: As the train sped by, she glimpsed the breathtaking view of the ocean from the window.
